text:
Restline - George A* Bernstein -2-
Military Record
May, 1941 to January, 1946s Served as officer in the Army in command of
truck and motorized units; twenty months in the European Theatre
of Operations in active command of troops under combat
conditions; during final six months in command of battalion
of 1200 men* Separated with rank of Captain.
Other Activities
Writing: During the period between January, 1946 and April, 1949, a-
number of articles were published in Marper^s, the Nation*
the New York Herald-Tribune. and other publications.
Teaching and lecturing: In connection with position as Educational
Director of Millinery Workers Union, AFL, conducted a number
of courses in Public Speaking and Parliamentary Procedure at
various trade union groups in and around New YÂ°rk City.
Other Data
Date of Birth April 5th, 1915
Place of Birth Mew Y0rk C'.ty
Single
Travelled'fairly extensively
in Europe, both before and
during the war* the
Caribbean Area, Eastern
United States and Canada.
Marital Status
Miscellaneous
Respectfully Submitted,
/s/George A. Bernstein
